annotation.TEXT: Whoa, the barn is now green! This really is bizarro world!
Moon count: 1
Also, may as well see where the midpoint entrance starts me while I'm here.

Oh, yeah. I may as well show this while I'm here. Pay attention to the word "TIME" in the status bar as I fly to the left. The number 4 will appear to the right of it shortly after I go past the door.
Nothing really secret out here...
Outta the way, Mr. Maverick...
Yes, a layer 2 door!
Hmm... It might've been safer to approach that No P-switch coin from the right, but I don't know... It would still be very tricky.
Obviously, spin jumping here is a bad idea (unless you're small).
Okay, now to show off that thing.
Okay, and finally, let's see what secrets I have yet to show in Switchless Castle...
Oh, but I just want to check one thing real quick in the castle...
Maybe I have to hit a different floor switch this time?
Whoa, that was close!
Um, what the heck?
Turn blocks... What could they mean? ...Oh, no... Not him!
So, you may be thinking that I could just grab all of the No P-switch coins in this area, then fly up to that bonus room, and I thought of that, but... I encountered a problem.
These chickens can't be collected. Also, there seems to be a barn in the pit, but I have used science to determine that attempts to land on or near the barn will fail and result in death.
The "sinking" part is fake! That's strange, since EVW had a few varieties of properly working appearing/disappearing blocks, so that's what I thought these were at first.
What I'm here to check involves this room...
Alright, you just keep mooing at nothing in particular while I check out what's to the right...
There it is. I wonder what it could mean...
It's tricky, but if you can perform a take off from one of these small ledges, it'll help somewhat.
Alright, now to quickly finish the level.
Yep, it's Mr. Wizard, and he's here to shoot magic at us and teach us some neat science-related stuff!
What the? Another evil-looking cow?
AAAHHH!!! So there are enemies here! It's a black turkey, the most evil turkey of them all!
Yep, we've got these bouncing Zelda 2 enemies, and they're just as indestructible as the red turkeys in the farm level.
Oh, and yes, you can just stand on this platform as it sinks all the way down and you'll be fine.
...and an actually reachable MOOOONNN!!!
Now, there is a lack of solid land for about a screen or two here, so I'm going to go and fly all the way to the right side of the level and then work my way back.
I wonder if the wizard's magic can still produce coins, 1-ups, or Thwimps...
Brown turkeys?! That's an unnatural color!
Uh, oh. Autoscrolling. Uh, oh. A "Beware" sign. Uh, oh. Aria of Sorrow music.
Had to fly over that pit since there were no ladders or anything there.
Now, if you really know what you're doing, you can fly over some obstacles here. It's very risky, though.
Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through TVW! If I missed anything major in this hack, let me know, but otherwise, I think I'm done! See ya!

And, of course, the No P-switch coin that the bonus room skips is just after that point of no return. I think it would've been a better idea if that bonus room either had an extra No P-switch coin in it, or if its warp returned you to this room so you could still collect this one. (Or just remove a piece of that one-way ledge so I could backtrack.)
Oh, and the chomp turkeys now flicker, just to make them seem even more menacing!
Unfortunately, there's actually nothing special up on the roof here, I don't think...
MOOOO...
Pay careful attention to the podoboos here. They tend to like the right-hand block in the low turn block pairs.
Maybe I should've sped up a few seconds of me waiting here.
Sigh, that moon... Also, notice the angry-looking red fuzzy below.
A ledge right here makes this a one-way route, so there's no going back for that bonus room after this point.
Now, see that hole in the ceiling? Fly into it, go left until you hit a wall, and then press up to enter a hidden door.
Now, see these sinking tiles? Well first of all...
Okay, and now for what I really wanted to show off here. Remember that evil-looking cow that I briefly saw last time I was here?
Oh, no! The chomp turkeys have gone nuclear!
Oh, yeah, gotta boil Mario's feet again, just for the heck of it!
Nothing up there. Now, let's enter the layer 2 room.

Yeah, that cow. Now, over the left side of this pit, there's a vertical line of teleport tiles that warp you to the "????????" screen with the goal sphere, and these teleport tiles stretch all the way to the top of the level. However, it's still possible to fly over them!

Okay, now this time, let's hop over the vertical line of teleport tiles that Joshi set up there. (Yes, I used tool-assistance for this, as well as elsewhere in the cheepo turkey zone, as I have to hang on to my cape to show you everything.)
Now, what could this music be? (It's the town of Vale from Golden Sun. Thanks, ThatUnluckyOne and NoctournalDonut!)

Also, hidden 1-up. I think the last three checkpoints are on each of the sinking tiles, but I'm not exactly sure where the first checkpoint is. I want to say that it's on the left side of the platform that had the rat on it, since the 1-up didn't appear for me until I tried jumping from there.
Moon count: Still 1
And, instead of yellow koopas, we get these guys, which are just as indestructible as their bouncing relatives.

The wizard stops appearing here. Go past the door to find the final No P-switch coin. Also, do not hug the right edge of the screen, or you'll pass through the donut and land in the lava! (Guess what happened on one of my off-camera scouting runs!)
...D'oh!!! I forgot, I'd hit midpoint last time, but I didn't complete the level afterwards... Okay, let me just quickly reclear the level here... (At least my cape will speed this up.)
Some bounce higher than others. Go under or over them, depending on what you feel more comfortable with.
I don't see any doors or pipes. Maybe the left edge of this area will teleport me?
Okay, now in addition to Kirby's Adventure music, we've got a midpoint that I don't want to hit yet, more sealed-off "items"...
And this is where the area stops. Anything in this barn? Doesn't look like it.
It would've been nice if there was like a coin arrow or something to hint at this.
Okay, and now to the left... I found out through yet another science experiment that there are invisible ledges underneath these coins.
There, black with a yellow outline suits you guys better!
D'oh! I didn't think he'd hit me there...
I wonder if that really is a fire escape... Who knows?
Wait, what? I didn't teleport?
Gotta jump over something that's in your way there to keep going back to the left.
Okay, now one of my goals is to locate the last No P-switch coin, and I will search high and low for it!
Perfect! ...Not that it matters, since I'm going to rewind my butt out of this bonus game trap in just a moment...
Chickens on ladders? I guess Diana was working overtime, maybe.
Huh. The No P-switch coins reappear, even though I got them all already. That's not what I'm here to check, though.
Joshis, save me!
Hello, and welcome to a brand new year! ...And also welcome back to TVW! Let's see what other stuff I can show off in these levels by using a cape...
Quadruple kill!
That super tall ledge is still there, just doin' its thing.
I don't know what the deal is with this super tall ledge...

Oh, yeah, and voting results, not that they matter: 1 vote for sparkling waters-1, 1 vote for 8-6, 1 vote for Strong Bad's house, 1 vote for Sky Sanctuary, 1 vote for, and 1 vote for me to have a Happy New Year!
Well, there's only one floor switch left for me to check...

Note: Even with the cape, getting back with the green chicken was somewhat tricky, and to be honest, I did use some rewinds for those few times I screwed up while trying to rush through the mission quickly.
A small room with a mushroom and a pipe.
Nope. There are teleporters in this room, but not there. Actually, to warp out of this room, just fall into any of the pits. They'll all lead to the same place.
Whoa, I seemed to have been warped into some twilighty type of zone... Let's explore to the right first.
Unfortunately, there seems to be a significant lack of solid land over here, so that's about it for this area (that I assume was a dummied-out level idea).
Yes, I've definitely gotta hunt that guy down and get the magic wand back so I can transform you into something less disturbing!

Ah, now up here, it appears that you can't go too far to the right, but if you fly or do a good enough jump from the higher ledge just to the right of the Thwomp, you can actually get over whatever's in your way and keep going!
And, yep, I had a feeling the moon would return! (It's a duplicate moon, of course, so my counter won't increase again.)
Oh, well, sucks for him. I guess I'm just about done with TVW...
Haw, haw at that Thwomp again! Also, you have to do a jump there to keep going.
...three 1-ups that you actually can collect...
Now, leaving that room sends you here, but I did not actually want to come here yet.
Okay, I think I'm past the cow now...
Is that floor switch broken? Hitting any part of it (even the underside) should trigger the warp...
Looks kind of like another copy of the level, but there are no enemies...

And, the pipe takes me right here, as expected. Now, I think this is where the bonus room should've dropped me off, so that I could still get that No P-switch coin right there in the same run (unless the one-way ledge had a piece removed from it).
Oh, god, no!!! The evil black turkeys have now somehow become even more evil, in the form of CHEEPO TURKEYS!!!
Power up I don't need.
And yes, I did some off screen sciences to determine where the land comes back.
I did some scouting ahead before starting this recording, and determined that if I enter that bonus room, you can't get all of the No P-switch coins in the same run.
Okay, next, TheGoomba98 informed me of a hidden 1-up at the beginning of MarioTropics that I didn't know about, so I'll just quickly show that off...
Okay, now I'm just gonna clear the main part of mission two here real quick... (The cape and Windows Movie Maker will speed this up!)
I wonder if that cow was actually trying to protect me from this evil place...
Now, there's one other secret here that just happened to never show up for me before. Watch the lava under this ledge...
No, Joshi, don't bring me here! JOSHIIIII!!!
You can safely bounce off the Thwomp up here, but you can't go anywhere to the left or right up there, so it's pointless.
...And that was indeed the teleporter this time. So, I guess the correct floor switch is randomly determined somehow? That's weird...
About the only way to kill them is to get them to fall into lava.
Ooh, jackpot!
But, how do I get out of here?
Well, there was a Thwimp, which got boiled immediately (LOL), so I guess those rares can still show up.
Umm... Snifit, you sent me to the normal exit with that door... Shouldn't you have sent me to the airship or something if you wanted me to change you back?
